title: Dream Teams Assemble: 2017 All-Star Event Update
body: Mark your calendars now! The 2017 All-Star Event will be held in the NA LCS Studio in Los Angeles on December 7-10.

replies.body: ok so you want to make the all star event more competitive thats cool. How about changing your mind on the BO1 format for NA so that the focus can be on our region being more competitive at international events!
Logged in to upvote

Have you listened to all of the conversations about this? I had the same gut response as you did at first, but I think overall it will be a good change all things considered. Aside from being a better viewer experience, it is still quite important to learn how to play Bo1's well, as this is still the primary first stage of tournaments. I have been further swayed by the Dive episode and other articles I've read.

Bo1's are less competitive by default. When we did have Bo1's it still did not help us at international events because we still sucked at Bo1's. As it turns out, the format of Bo1's meant that no one was being challenged to be good at the game, only to be good at a single strategy or preparing cheese twice a week to cover up gaping flaws. If your cheese fails you fall flat because you simply never had to learn the game, and if that single strategy you were running gets figured out in week 2 you go 0-10.
Agreed. I still don't get how the limited international experience after a split and a half of BO3s provided enough evidence that NA was not improving from them.
The fun modes were the whole point of All Stars for me. We watch them compete in normal games the whole year. Why would I want to watch them do it again a month after Worlds?

I agree completely. I'm not just disappointed, I'm disgusted with their move from fun game modes to a more competitive approach. We watch the pros go against each other in international events multiple times a year. These fun modes were the only reason to watch All Stars. 

Riot is feeding us a line of BS claiming they don't want the pro's competitive mindset to get distracted or whatever. What a load of crap. 

If you're going to feed us shit Riot at least give us the courtesy of telling us it's shit instead of trying to package it as cheesecake.

agreed i mean, the tournament is over, and it's just for 3 days. let them have fun and enjoy themselves. after all they got quite some time before the next tournaments come back up if im right. let them enjoy themselves and have fun
100% Agree

I totally agree fun modes were the best thing about All-Stars. I just hope players go up there with the same "having fun" mentality and pick fun matchups to watch just to answer Riot. At the end of the day, at the end of the day, there is still no prize pool, so why not?

We don't need another competition... We already have spring split, MSI, summer split, rift rivals, and worlds. Time to have some fun after all of that. It seems like you guys are shooting air-ball after air-ball lately. The all-star games were fun and exciting after a long year of competition. Everyone loves seeing their favorite player have a little fun in tandem mode, or a 5 blitz v 5 blitz matchup. RIP the fun parts of league.

Wasn't the point of the all-star event to have some more laid-back fun? We already have worlds finishing in November, and now we have another tournament** right after.**

To address the "competitiveness" point: When Worlds is just 30 days before All-stars, do we really need **more** competitive games? All-stars always felt like a nice little break between Worlds and the beginning of the next season.

I was looking forward to this (I actually was thinking of attending), but now that it's just another bland tournament I don't think I'm anywhere near as interested.

Really hoping this decision is reconsidered. Very disappointed.
I'm really disappointed in this change. I enjoyed the fun modes and laid-back, crazy atmosphere of All-Stars; it really set it apart from the other super serious tournaments.

I literally re-watch the All-star games that are crazy. The assassins mode, marksman mode, one for all. It is extremely disappointing that this will only be normal league. I hope you change your mind Riot.

I still watch the wildcard regions at All Stars 2016. Ceros popping off on Diana and straight up oneshotting everything in assassin mode never got old for me.

For reference:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qf_93R-oCzs&list=PLVgS_BIOY01wVMAwpUkYJc81wPIXWjYP-&index=7
Wasn't the whole point of the event to have fun? There's not much point in making the entire season competitive, when you already have two regional splits, MSI, Rift Rivals and Worlds.

i thought all-star was all about the fun modes. it was nice to have a break from all the competitiveness and watch everybody have some fun with mirror matchups and 1v1's. i think its taking away the purpose of all-star

I may not be a pro & cannot speak for them but I disagree. I think pros would want to have a "fun" tournament. They need a break from all the competitiveness, that's what Worlds is for. All-Stars should be about fun/entertainment. This is essentially a bigger international Rift Rival in disguise. Region vs Region FFA.

Riot, what in the world are you thinking. NOBODY cared about the competitive region games in the past all stars. Everyone came to watch Bjerg + Faker control one champion, or everyone playing the same champion in one for all. This is a huge mistake and I guarantee you will see a HUGE decline in viewship. Also what is the incentive for pros to take this seriously? There is no prize!

Is this a joke?  October fools? That will never catch on... But seriously this is terrible... "we’re saying goodbye to the the unfettered mayhem..." aka we're saying goodbye to, fun!?  Who the hell cares about a more competitive All-star event.  That is not the point of it at all.  The pros need a break from the competitiveness of the rest of the year, not another Rift Rivals 2.0

"Our goal for ASE 2017 is to provide a _**fun **_and exciting series of matchups between pros from around the world." Well you have failed in this goal already Riot, failed...  Bring back the game modes!

I guess I won't be watching All Star this year...  I want to watch Pro Players beat each other with their absurd skills on things they wouldn't play in a normal Pro game.  Not watch BabyWorlds.  This is a stupid change.

I do not like this proposed format, and would much rather see more rotating game modes played by professionals. I'd honestly prefer to keep the old 1v1 tournament style bracket that included everyone participating; however, I realize that something has to give in this situation. I'd suppose the later to be something that I'm more comfortable parting with.

So, they wanna kill all the fun modes and the fun in general (unusual/ "off-meta" picks) and make the pros just go full tryhard mode all season long, killing the fun for both them and the viewers. Seems legit. #RitoGame(s)

introduced Rift Rivals which was completely unnecessary. Have you lost your shit Riot ? Wasnt all star supposed to be a fun event where you could troll and just let the players and the viewers have fun ? I wont even watch all stars if its just another stale competitive event

Haha Are u kidding? 
First of all u take away other regions, wich i think cut off some fun and let a lot of fans disappointed! I mean, i follow all regions, i want to vote for so many of them! 
And the mainly thing that gets me mad... u freaking make another event after worlds!? I was soooo looking forward to see my favorite players have fun, not to be competitive...of course i want them to win but c’mon, see them with 10 blitz was so cool! I hope you change your mind Riot smh

I will not be watching this year now. No one gives a shit about the competitiveness of the All star games. No other sport does either. I come to watch two people play one champion and play all for one. Your esports team is fucking killing pro league of legends for me.
Watched it for the fun modes. Won't watch it this year
I won't be tuning in if that is the case. Loved it for the fun aspect of the tournament.
I only watch all-stars for the fun game modes. If I wanted to watch teams try as hard as they can internationally I'd watch worlds and Rift Rivals. Leave all-stars the way it is for the fans
This change sucks

Rito....WHAT THE HECK ARE YOU GUYS DOING?!?!?!?!?! First, you say "oh Bo3s aren't giving proper competition, so we will go to Bo1s (mainly for more viewership and $)." Now, you are saying "oh the whole fun part of All-Stars isn't healthy for the competitiveness of the players." Whoever is making these recent decisions needs to be FIRED tenfold...these decisions are some of the most idiotic ones I've seen Riot make in my 3 1/2 years of playing League....HOLY CRAP

All Star is supposed to be fun and relax not competitive im disappointed they changed the format and removed the fun game modes. I wish they kept the Fire and Ice teams and just add a wildcard team to each team

Riot please don't make this tournament a competitive tournament! The whole purpose of All-Stars is to give all those Professionals a relaxed/fun setting to play in and not really care. It's so much more fun to watch the bonus game modes and see their hilarious picks than watch them be competitive. Please reconsider this decision.

I don't mind having more competitive events... but I really liked that the All-Star Event was more of a fun display than just a second version of Worlds. It created a change of pace that was really appreciated.

It was probably good for the Pros as well - since reminding themselves that the game is fun is probably healthy for them once in a while ;)
Riot said: We don't have enough seats in NA LCS Studio, so we will take away all the fun modes this ASE. {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
Don't Change plis All buy Fun modes..no need more copetitve challengs

I feel like this change is just fine.  I mean, if you want to watch the pros goof around, go watch their streams in the off season or between splits.  They play against other pros a lot of the time even in solo q.  Honestly I like the idea of Riot gearing towards the more serious fan base.  There are those of us who play the game not just to kill stuff, but to get better every match.  Who watch pro play not just to be entertained, but to learn.  And who despite taking the game too seriously, will never be a pro player.  Those kinds of fans and players deserve to be catered to as well.  And I think we all should like that idea of the "perfect team" from one region going against the "perfect team" from another region in a serious atmosphere.  Give us some fuel for those "EU is better than NA" debates.  Anyone who's ever done a fantasy draft to start their franchise mode in Madden NFL video games will appreciate this change.

>  Honestly I like the idea of Riot gearing towards the more serious fan base.
> Those kinds of fans and players deserve to be catered to as well.

Yeah because it's not like they get to see what they want (competitiveness) throughout the whole year...OH WAIT.

What’s the point of the tournament now? I literally just finished watching all the all stars games from last year again because they’re fun and enjoyable. Who doesn’t love watching all those game modes????? What are y’all thinking?!???

I really wish this was our "for fun event" not only is it going to make things less enjoyable to watch (tandem mode was possibly the greatest thing ive seen) but it will also give more stress to the players, they enjoy the entertainment value as much as the rest of us. league is serious enough as it is, everyone needs to blow off steam now and then.
The players will all be on vacation, not practicing constantly and keeping up with the meta. Saying this will be a competitive tournament does not make it so.
And oh, please discontinue rift rivals as its absolutely useless

Salty EU fanboy?  If you don't want to watch competitive league, go play some arams or something.  The rest of us will enjoy watching how the different regions stack up against each other since it only happens maybe twice a year.
Yeah. It happens twice a year already, that's the whole point, we already did this for Rift Rivals. It's just re-funneling that idea and calling it "All-Stars" instead.

All I can think of is Froggen saying, "I was told we were going to have fun. I did not have fun."

But honestly that has been the point of All Stars, for it to be fun. I thought MSI was supposed to be serious and All Stars relaxed. I had an absolute blast when I went a few years ago, with Huni screaming and going after everyone in tandem mode. I wish that tone would have been kept, unless the pros expressed not liking it.

Somebody wanna let me know why Brazil gets a spot instead of CIS??!! Albus Nox Luna anybody? Not to mention the CIS squad represented the Wildcards at All-Stars 2015.  I just don't get why we would have Brazil but not CIS
